intro: Crotalaria chinensis, commonly known as Chinese crotalaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to East Asia, particularly China, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and contain toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to livestock. Crotalaria chinensis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
